page.title: 16WHITNASH CEMETERY.
page.content:
Whitnash Cemetery is in Brunswick Street.It was originally used as farmland. Whitnash Cemetery took up about 1/12 of our square so we decided to go and find out information about it.There are 11 acres of land.The cemetery was first used in 1851.
Warwickshire District Council became responsible for the cemetery in 1974. The averge number of burials a year is 155.There are 4 full time employees at the cemetery and 5 in the summer. The graves are dug by a mechanical digger.
A log book including the names of all the buried is kept at Regent Square in Leamington Spa. The most famous person buried there is Randolph Turpin the boxer.
